verbs.description: unzone (third-person singular simple present unzones, present participle unzoning, simple past and past participle unzoned)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To remove from an assigned zone or zoning.
examples: St. Claude Avenue, from Poland to Delery Street is now zoned and I trust the Council will not unzone it and open it up to picture shows and other business places.

entries.meaning: (transitive, poetic, archaic) To free from a girdle.
examples: To this sad urn the fragrant cypress bring, / With the soft violets of the budding spring; / Breathe the deep sigh, unzone the sobbing breast, / And bid these ashes in sweet slumbers rest;
